byline.original: By LANDON THOMAS Jr. and CHAD BRAY

lead_paragraph: The lender said that it did not seek the intervention of the German government in a dispute over underwriting of residential mortgage-backed securities.

headline.print_headline: Deutsche Bank Denies It Sought Germany’s Help in Dispute With U.S.
headline.main: Deutsche Bank Denies Asking Germany to Help in U.S. Dispute

snippet: The lender said that it did not seek the intervention of the German government in a dispute over underwriting of residential mortgage-backed securities....
abstract: Shares of Deutsche Bank, Germany's largest financial institution, hit new low following report that German government will not bail it out; troubled bank denies it asked Chancellor Angela Merkel to intervene with demand by United States Justice Dept for $14 billion in penalties stemming from Deutsche Bank's role in financial crisis; many speculate bank will have to tap investors for more cash.
